meanings.definition: To remove from a position of authority or privilege, especially from the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The bishop was defrocking the priest for his misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The church decided to defrock the pastor after the scandal.
meanings.sent3: The defrocking of the mayor from his role caused quite a stir in the town.
meanings.sent4: Her resignation felt like a defrocking of her power within the organization.
meanings.sent5: The defrocking ceremony was a solemn event, marking the end of his leadership.

meanings.definition: The act of stripping someone of their official title or position.
meanings.sent1: The defrocking of the CEO shocked the employees.
meanings.sent2: The defrocking of the general was a major blow to the army.
meanings.sent3: The defrocking of the principal from his office was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The defrocking of the champion left a vacancy in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The defrocking of the queen from her throne was a historic event.
